info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 30 at 8:47PM CDT until August 4 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Des Moines IA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa...
Iowa River near Tama Hwy E49 affecting Tama and Poweshiek Counties.
Cedar River at Cedar Falls affecting Black Hawk County.
Winnebago River at Mason City affecting Cerro Gordo, Floyd and Worth Counties.
Shell Rock River at Shell Rock affecting Bremer, Black Hawk and Butler Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...The Cedar River at Cedar Falls, or from the West Fork Cedar River to the Cedar Falls-Waterloo city limits.
* WHEN...Until early Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 91.0 feet, Water affects Big Woods Rd south of Dunkerton Rd as well as the north parking lot of Island Park.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 88.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 91.0 feet Friday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 89.0 feet.
info.instruction:
For the latest waterway observations and forecasts refer to weather.gov/desmoines/water.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
River forecasts include observed precipitation plus forecast precipitation over the next 24 hours.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING
